alert.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 6 at 4:03AM MST until March 7 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Denver CO
alert.areas: South and Southeast Grand/West Central and Southwest Boulder/Gilpin/Clear Creek/Summit/North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet
alert.desc:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 10
inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph.

* WHERE...The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and
the Indian Peaks.

* WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 11 PM MST Friday. The heaviest
snow and greatest impacts will occur Friday afternoon and evening.

* IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous.
alert.instruction:
Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow
extra time to reach your destination.

alert.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 6 at 4:03AM MST until March 7 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Denver CO
alert.areas: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson/Larimer/North and Northeast Grand/Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet
alert.desc:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 12
inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass, and Rocky Mountain National Park and the
Medicine Bow Range.

* WHEN...Until 11 PM MST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous.
alert.instruction:
Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow
extra time to reach your destination.

alert.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 6 at 2:50PM MST until March 7 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Denver CO
alert.areas: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson/Larimer/North and Northeast Grand/Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet
alert.desc:
* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches.
Winds gusting as high as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass, and Rocky Mountain National Park and the
Medicine Bow Range.

* WHEN...Until 11 PM MST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel will be slick and hazardous due to snow covered
roads.
alert.instruction:
Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow
extra time to reach your destination.

alert.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 6 at 2:50PM MST until March 7 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Denver CO
alert.areas: South and Southeast Grand/West Central and Southwest Boulder/Gilpin/Clear Creek/Summit/North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet
alert.desc:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and
7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph.

* WHERE...The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and
the Indian Peaks.

* WHEN...Until 11 PM MST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel will be hazardous due to snow covered roads. The
hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday evening, and Friday
commutes.
alert.instruction:
Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow
extra time to reach your destination.
